SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractDAO<T>
Class used to define the C-R-U-D operations used for managing the database with the objects given in the application.
AgeValidator
Validator that implements the validate method, in this case the validation of the age, the age of a client must be over 18 in order for he/she to be able to place any orders.
App
The Main which starts the whole application and creates all the views as well as the controller.
AppTest
Unit test for simple App.
Bill
Represents the immutable object on which details of an order are set for each of them.
BillBLL
Business Logic Level class used for accessing the methods from the Data Access Layer in order to provide an extra stage of checking data in the case of the bills class there are no validators needed.
BillDAO
Class that extends the AbstractDAO class, taking its methods and also implementing a specific method for bills that is used to select all the bills from the database and storing them into an array.
BillMaker
Class used for creating the bill text field.
Client
Represents the definition of the Client object which comes and places an order that needs to be fulfilled.
ClientBLL
Business Logic Level class used for accessing the methods from the Data Access Layer in order to provide an extra stage of checking data.
ClientDAO
Class that extends the AbstractDAO class, taking its methods.
ClientsView
Clients window implementation similar to the other 2 GUIs.
ConnectionFactory
Class used for establishing the connection to the database.
Controller
Class used for the main logic of the application and the listener for the buttons The controller receives as arguments the views (GUIs) of the application and has inner classes for each button.
EmailValidator
Validator that implements the validate method, in this case the validation of the email, the input string must be compiled by a pattern that accepts a specific pattern for emails.
MainView
Main GUI implementation present in this class, it just has 3 buttons that redirect the user to the other 3 specific GUIs that are used.
NameValidator
Validator that implements the validate method, in this case the validation of the price which needs to be above 0.0 whenever we want to insert a new product.
Order
Class that describes the Order object which is placed by each user between a client and a product
OrderBLL
Business Logic Level class used for accessing the methods from the Data Access Layer in order to provide an extra stage of checking data in the case of the orders class there are no validators needed.
OrderDAO
Class that extends the AbstractDAO class, taking its methods.
OrdersView
The GUI for the Orders window in which each button, text field and label are implemented.
PriceValidator
Validator that implements the validate method, in this case the validation of the price which needs to be above 0.0 whenever we want to insert a new product.
Product
Class that describes the Product object used in the application that represents the object that can be ordered by a client
ProductBLL
Business Logic Level class used for accessing the methods from the Data Access Layer in order to provide an extra stage of checking data through the various validators for this class: PriceValidator and QuantityValidator.
ProductDAO
Class that extends the AbstractDAO class and has a single method specific for each product : the updateProduct method which is needed specifically for this class because it's quantity(stock) needs to be updated after an order is placed
ProductsView
The GUI for the Products window in which each button, text field and label are implemented.
QuantityValidator
Validator that implements the validate method, in this case the validation of the quantity which needs to be above 0 whenever we want to insert a new product.
Validator<T>
Interface that gives a validation method that needs to be implemented by each specific validator.
